meanings.definition: The quality or state of being cyclic.
meanings.sent1: The cyclicality of the seasons brings predictability to nature.
meanings.sent2: Economists study the cyclicality of market trends to make forecasts.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations followed a strange cyclicality, changing colors every hour.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings had a cyclicality akin to the changing tides.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the cyclicality of life in a mesmerizing painting.

meanings.definition: The tendency to occur in cycles.
meanings.sent1: The cyclicality of fashion trends makes old styles come back in vogue.
meanings.sent2: Historians analyze the cyclicality of political revolutions throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The cyclicality of the washing machine's spin cycle never fails to amuse the toddler.
meanings.sent4: The cyclicality of the moon's phases mirrors the ebb and flow of life.
meanings.sent5: The cyclicality of the stock market can be both thrilling and nerve-wracking.
